name: Westin Portland

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We were in room 1912, a corner room on the top floor. And yes, we had a wonderful view of Mount Hood.
reviews.title: Let's Talk About the Bathroom

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The room isn't large, but it has floor-to-ceiling windows that open at the bottom (completely safe), is well-appointed, and very clean. But it's really all about the bathroom: it is magical. Those same floor-to-ceiling windows that open? They're in the bathroom. The room is filled with natural light. The shower, very large and well-appointed, has glass walls that are perfectly kept. I don't know how the housekeeper did it but there wasn't a water mark anywhere. (NB: My master bath has a glass shower and we keep a squeegee there so we can swipe the walls after every shower.) The shower has both rain shower and handheld options. And it's large. And the lip at the bottom keeps the water in the shower stall and not all over the floor. And if you can tear yourself out of the shower, there's a stool to sit on. And double sinks. And good artificial light. But trust me, even for someone like my spouse who normally takes a 2-minute shower, it's hard to get out.
reviews.title: Good location

reviews.text: So what's the downside of this well-situated hotel where even the elevators have beautiful art? There's no concierge. That's okay, except that the very friendly front desk and front door staffs are not up to advising tourists. The hotel management is missing a step here. The Westin should provide pre-printed directions to major tourist sites (for example, the Japanese Gardens), directions that have correct information about public transportation. And the Westin needs to subscribe to some sort of "clipping service" that would help keep the staff informed. For example, we had booked a table at Ava Gene's. Why? It was both in the NYTimes travel section (July 2013) and selected as one of the ten best restaurants in America by Bon Appetit (August 2013). But no one at the front desk or front door had heard of the restaurant. These are problems that are easy to fix and I expect Westin to do that...especially since I'm already trying to figure out when to go back to Portland and to room 1912 again.
reviews.title: OK but I'm sure better available in Downtown Portand

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The Westin is a favourite chain of ours but I have to say I fail to understand why the larger chains charge for wifi when even coffee shops and smaller hotels give it free! Nevertheless the room was fine and the location was great! Paid a fortune for valet parking but you have to expect that in a city I guess! Just be careful you don't get a room near the air con units outside!
reviews.title: Could have been better.

reviews.text: For the $250+ per night charge for the honor of staying with the Westin, the bed was as tired as I was when I woke up. Vents blew AC directly on the head of the bed...somewhat of a "wind chill" . Bad enough that I had to put a towel over it. $250+ a night (two night stay) and I still had to pay for internet in the room? The wonderful thing about traveling a lot for business...you never have to stay in a place you don't like twice. The PEOPLE WERE GREAT.
reviews.title: Asked for quiet and was given the busiest street with the bus route
Great central location, great service and "nice digs"
reviews.text: We had a great visit to Portland partly because of the Westin is a great hotel and because Portland is a great town.

reviews.title: I expected better
reviews.text: The Westin is located right in the city's center. Everything is within easy walking distance. The staff was friendly, helpful and solicitous. The rooms are a good size for a city hotel, clean and well appointed.

reviews.title: Central location
reviews.text: Love that "Heavenly Bed"!!

reviews.title: Portland Thanksgiving
reviews.text: Even our dog says "Thanks" for contributing to a great weekend in Portland!

reviews.title: Hidden Gem in big city
reviews.text: I stayed at this hotel on 12/7, and checkout out 12/8. I wish I could give a 2.5 star rating as it would be a more accurate reflection of my experience.

This hotel is nicely located in downtown Portland. Its within walking distance to a lot. The valet is $35 save the money and park at city parking lot. If you walk 3 blocks parking is $10 for 24 hrs. It doesn't have in and out privileges but it still way cheaper!
reviews.title: Nice location
Great service
reviews.text: I stay here often even though I may have a meeting in another hotel this is where I will lay my head ....comfort clean,quiet,and above all great service and location!!!
The front desk staff is always ready to p,ease.
reviews.title: Amazing.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed July 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The bellman outside all remember your name and welcome you back each time!
reviews.title: Great hotel and location

reviews.text: I stay often so upon arrival they say "welcome home "
reviews.title: Well run hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We stayed two nights on Starwood points ( and Westin is our preferred Starwood brand as it suits our lifestyle and meets our expectations and this stay was no different. Positives - large room, full amenities, good quality products and of course a heavenly bed. Very good location downtown within a block of shopping and several blocks from the Pearl District. Outstanding - doormen - they were simply awesome - we brought our bikes and they graciously stored them as they couldn't park our vehicle with then attached and happily retrieved them when we wanted to go for a ride. Always at the door and responded immediately to any question. Room for improvement - wifi was very disappointing - and this was the gold amenity we chose. Terrible band width and when we advised the front desk of our concern - the girl said she'd have the router reset but never followed up with us and the service never improved. Parking per night is $35 which seems on the high side. All in all however, a good stay and a fair use of our points.
reviews.title: A good Westin experience

reviews.text: We had an excellent stay at this hotel. Location is fantastic - right in the center of town and in close walking proximity of the Pearl District.
reviews.title: Comfortable hotel, excellent location, super friendly staff

reviews.text: All staff were exceptionally helpful and polite. The room itself exceeded Westin standards and was very comfortable and clean. Valet parking was speedy.
reviews.title: Excellent Hotel

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The only issue of note was that our room included a breakfast package for two people. We were given a gift card in the amount of $25 per day to use at their Daily Grill restaurant. This credit amount does not cover the cost of even a basic breakfast for two. Not a big deal and did not taint the experience, just worth pointing out.
reviews.title: Perfect Location & Great Hotel

reviews.text: Overall, this is an excellent hotel and a recommended choice when in Portland.
reviews.title: Better than expected

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: A Westin Hotel as it should be! friendly staff, great location, excellent breakfast. Good for Business travellers, less perfect for families. Downtown all on foot!
reviews.title: Great downtown location!

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We just returned from a 3 night stay at the hotel and we loved it. The location is just fantastic for getting around as well as for proximity to restaurants, coffee shops etc.. The staff could not have been nicer. The maid did a great job on the room every day and special requests were handled immediately and with care. We would not want to stay anywhere else on a return trip. There were more street people in Portland than we expected but they were in many parts of the city as well as along the waterfront. None were aggressive towards us; just the usual panhandling. We arrived on a flight from Salt Lake City around 9am so we left our luggage at the hotel while we went to "Mothers" for breakfast. The hotel offered to call our cell phone when the room was ready. We went back to the hotel around noon and our room was ready. The Westin "grill" restaurant is opened 24 hours so that is great for late night snacks. We are early risers and healthy eaters so we appreciated the fruit plate and fresh yoghurt breakfast item. It was a great hotel stay with quiet rooms and beautiful bed linens.
reviews.title: Loved our stay

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed September 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: We are Starwood Gold Preferred Guests and usually patronize Starwood Hotels when in most U.S. cities. The Westin Portland met our standards for a great Westin hotel. The rooms and common areas were clean and well-kept and the bedding and bed were of usual high quality. The front desk staff and valet parking staff were both helpful and cheerful. The room decor was not the most modern or of the Westins we have stayed in, but it was certainly more than acceptable and in good condition. In our standard King room, the bathroom was of ample size with the Westin-style dual showerheads in the shower and a separate tub.
reviews.title: Great, solid Westin

reviews.text: We chose this hotel primarily because Westins are consistent, and we wanted a convenient location. This hotel is a couple blocks outside the busiest part of downtown, which made it a bit easier for driving purposes (not that anywhere in Portland seemed difficult). Very convenient to highways, the airport and other parts of town.
reviews.title: Fabulous Location

reviews.text: We did not eat in the restaurant, but did order room service for breakfast, and enjoyed it.
reviews.title: Just a basic hotel - more boutique style than Westin style
Terrific Room!
reviews.text: I stayed at the Westin in Tucson with girlfriends a few years back and it was awesome....I LOVED the heavenly beds and told my husband that he must try them out someday. Well, here we are and I must say that the bed was just as awesome as I remembered it!! We got a terrific corner room with basically wraparound windows, including the bathroom! It had a huge practically floor to ceiling window, huge glass enclosed shower with dual shower heads...the entire hotel room was light and airy. Definetly get a corner room if you can.
I stayed at the Westin Portland on a business trip last year and had an enjoyable stay, so I chose it again for this year's visit to Portland.
reviews.title: Decent stay, hotel could use a minor refurb

likes.disliked: — Overall, the hotel is nice...just nothing special

reviews.text: The young lady at the check-in counter was obviously a new-hire in training, so the process itself was pretty slow. Not a big deal, everyone has to start somewhere and I was in her position once as well.
reviews.title: Great Central Location, Nice Spacious Rooms, PLUS a Daily Grill!

reviews.text: I was pleasantly surprised that the packages I had shipped to the hotel were noted on my booking and quickly retrieved by the front desk agent. I know that seems like a small detail, but I often have to pull out tracking information as proof that a package had, in fact, been received by the hotel so this was a nice bonus.
reviews.title: Good location, but the hotel needs an upgrade

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed October 2007, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: The rooms itself was okay. Of course the Westin Heavenly Bed is wonderful, but the room itself could use a minor refurb. The walls are very scuffed and the carpets are worn. The room overall, though, was clean and comfortable with a nice over-sized bathroom.
reviews.title: Poor Choice

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed March 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: This is the 'go-to' hotel for my wife and I while we're in Portland. The service that we have received has always been top notch and the hotel has a perfect location for walking pretty much anywhere in the Downtown area. The "Food Truck" block is a half block away and I eat here about 90% of the time. There are so many food trucks, representing probably 25+ different countries/cuisines, that you can avoid the 15 hour flight to China or Russia by eating here. Shopping, both mega-mall's and smaller 'Mom n' Pop' shops are very close by, as is the marina district.
reviews.title: I need a 4.5 star rating...
Love this place!
reviews.text: I wish the gym had a better view but the equipment is top of the line so that's a bonus. The other big drawback is the parking situation. It's teh same in almost every big city nowadays but it still bugs me to pay $25+ per day to park.

We love staying at the Westin in Portland. The rooms are beautiful and comfortable; the bathrooms are large and luxurious, and the staff is friendly. There are lots of restaurants, bars, and places to shop nearby. You can't beat this hotel in downtown Portland.
reviews.title: A place you can depend on.

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: From the moment you arrive at the front door, things just seem to always be done right. The bell team and front desk staff zoom you though check-in painlessly. The rooms are large, well designed and comfortable. Situated in the downtown area, we ended up walking to most destinations. We did need transportation one evening, and a town car was at the front door in 4 minutes. Great home away from home.
reviews.title: Spacious rooms with great views

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed August 2013, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: My partner and I spent the holiday weekend at the Westin in Portland. Located right downtown, it was easy to walk to everything. The rooms were updated, spacious, and had great views. The staff was very friendly, welcoming, and accomodating.
reviews.title: Great Location, Clean, Comfortable

reviews.text: I knew The Westin Portland was going to be good. Every time I called, the telephone was answered with a clear voice that took the time to say each word. I can't tell you how much of a turn-off it is that the very rushed getallthewordsoutasfasasyoucansoyoucangettothenextcall commonplace telephone greeting is for me.
reviews.title: so impressed.

reviews.text: upon arriving the door to the hotel was opened for me. Call me old-fashioned, but I love this touch. In-fact, I never had to open the front door once during my stay. More about the doormen later.
reviews.title: 2 Star hotel for a 5 Star price

reviews.text: The Front Desk clerk was very cordial and polite, I believe her name was Anna. As I was just at the hotel one night and came and went quite a bit, Anna was always a friendly face upon my returns.
reviews.title: Great place to stay
Bellmen/Valet shady and dishonest
reviews.text: My room was nice. A little out-dated in that Fairmont-y/classic/victorian way. Not my aesthetic, but well kept-up. LOVED my bathroom. A HUGE picture window IN the BATHROOM. LOVE that. Absolutely worth the extra for a corner room.

The next morning, I set my alarm clock wrong (my fault - not the westin's) so was running late for my train and when I expressed the urgency of my departure to the doorman, he got me a complimentary towncar to take me to the train station. What service!
reviews.title: Nice hotel, great fireplace, but nothing extra special

likes.disliked: — Valet "misplaced" the car -- took a really long time for them to find it, too.

reviews.text: We are Starwood gold members and have stayed at many SPG properties, including Seattle and Atlanta within the last week alone. This was one of the worst run hotels I have ever stayed at. It really is a shame since the property is ideally located. The hotel itself is charming and the rooms are OK, What problems they had, ie. lack of towels and burnt out light bulbs are mainly service related. We had many problems, but here are a few low lights-
reviews.title: Beware- Not up to Westin Standards

reviews.text: -Waiting for bellman to take our car after getting honked at on the street because the cars were so stacked up you couldn't get to the curb. Found them inside talking about their golf game.
reviews.title: Ok not great

likes.liked: — the free coffee in the lobby

reviews.title: Wonderful Stay
reviews.text: -Getting off the elevator and seeing uniformed housekeeping staff lounging and chatting in the upholstered chairs. Seeing them still there over 30 minutes later

reviews.stay_parameters: Stayed April 2008, traveled as a couple
reviews.text: -Leaving our room at 8AM and returning at 3:30PM to a dirty room.
reviews.title: Very nice.
Fantastic Hotel in a Superb Location
reviews.text: The attitude when we complained was very laid back. The manager on duty said OK so many times, I finally said, NO, it's not OK. She never even apologized.

description: The Westin Portland Hotel is located In the center of Downtown Portland with easy access to some of the city's best dining, shopping, and entertainment.
